text: Don Pedro de Anda Altamirano (c. 1551 - 27 January 1619) was a Spanish conquistador, judge, and colonizer of New Spain. As a captain in the Spanish Colonial Army, de Anda helped lead the Spanish conquest of the Bajío region of Mexico during the Chichimeca War.El Ciudadano Jalisco - Afectan la Mesa Redonda Following the suppression of the Chichimeca people, de Anda helped lead the colonization effort in the Jalisco Highlands and founded the Villa de Santa María de los Lagos, modern day Lagos de Moreno. ==History== Pedro de Anda Altamirano was born in Spain to family of Basque nobility. He served as a captain in the colonial army of New Spain, having notably helped lead the Spanish conquest of Chichimeca people in the Bajío region of Mexico.La Conquista Militar de los Altos de Jalisco Government of Tepatitlan After the conquest of the Chichimecas, de Anda helped lead the colonization of the Jalisco Highlands in the Western Bajío region. In 1563, he and Captain Hernando Martel founded the Villa de Santa María de los Lagos (modern day Lagos de Moreno),This settlement was renamed to Lagos de Moreno following the Mexican War of Independence after Mexican insurgent hero Pedro Moreno. along with 73 noble Spanish families and their servants and slaves.Periódico AM - Jurisdicción de la Villa de LagosVisita Lagos de Moreno - Historia In 1565 Captain de Anda was given a hacienda and a land grant by the Royal Audiencia of the Kingdom of Nueva Galicia outside of Lagos de Moreno named Hacienda el Xaral, which included the famous Mesa Redonda plateau.El Jaral Hacienda - HistoriaVerdeBandera - La Mesa Redonda de Lagos de Moreno, Emblema en PeligroLa Gaceta - Un Umblema en PeligroBonito Leon - Cerro la Mesa Redonda ==Family== Dⁿ Pedro de Anda Altamirano married Dᵃ Beatriz González de Castañeda in 1565, with whom he had two sons: *Esteban de Anda Altamirano, proprietor of the Tierras de San Nicolás de FríasSomos Primos (2002 Edition) Society of Hispanic Historical and Ancestral Research *Juan de Anda Altamirano, captain of the Spanish Army in New Spain and husband of Dᵃ Juana Ruiz de Nava. Captain de Anda's descendants formed part of the colonial elite of the Jaliscan Highlands. Among his descendants include notable writers, politicians, and other prominent Mexican personalities including:San Juan de los Lagos Region de Los Altos de JaliscoSan Julián Region de Los Altos de JaliscoEncarnación de Díaz Region de Los Altos de Jalisco * Fortino Ibarra de Anda (1895-), writer * José Silverio de Anda Temblador (1838-1907), writer * José Guadalupe de Anda (1880-1950), Senator of the Republic and writer * Manuel Romo de Anda, Municipal President of Encarnación de Díaz (1918) * Miguel de Anda Jacobsen (1927–present), writer and academic * Elías De Anda Ramírez, Municipal President of San Julián (1929) * Pedro de Anda Muñoz, Municipal President of San Juan de los Lagos (1932-1933) * Ramiro Navarro de Anda, footballer for the Mexico national football team in the 1966 FIFA World Cup * Marcelino Romo de Anda, Municipal President of San Juan de los Lagos (1968-1970) * Noel Pérez de Anda, Municipal President of San Juan de los Lagos (1971-1973) * Rafael Pérez de Anda, Municipal President of San Juan de los Lagos (1980-1982) * Alejandro de Anda Lozano, Municipal President of Lagos de Moreno (2007), San Juan de los Lagos (2007-2009) * Hugo Zamora de Anda, Municipal President of Lagos de Moreno (2009)Diario Oficial de la Federación de Enero de 2009 * Juan Alberto Márquez de Anda, Municipal President of Lagos de Moreno (2015-2018)Presidente Municipal Government of Lagos de Moreno ==References== Category:Spanish conquistadors Category:16th-century Spanish people Category:City founders Category:Basque conquistadors Category:Explorers of Mexico Category:1551 births Category:1619 deaths
